intro: Podorungia, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. Podorungia species are characterized by their delicate, often fragrant flowers that come in a range of colors, including white, yellow, and purple. They typically grow in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of their mountainous habitat. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits that reflect their specialized ecological niches.
